result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample by 4:00 p.m. on 10/21/2022.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay a fine in the amount of $1,000.00.
All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge and DV assessment are due by 4/19/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance returned to the poster.
DV assessment imposed.

The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel Noel Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Gabriel Noel Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made *

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 DAY in the House of Correction; with credit for 1 DAY served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Defendant to provide a DNA sample by 4:00 pm on 10/21/22.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Pay a fine in the amount of $1,000.00.
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and DV assessment are due by: 4/19/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.

*The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Gabriel Noel Santiago.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Tristan J. Bednarek and Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, court ordered the domestic abuse repeater enhancer removed in count 1. Defense counsel further requests a Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Foley J. Van Lieshout appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RMK, CS.

Defendant Gabriel Noel Santiago in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/01/2022@2:30p

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
04/10/22.    22RM019775
